programme.title: Air Disasters
programme.desc: Pilots leaving Cameroon steer their plane clear of a storm, but the aircraft begins rolling to the right, and they are unable to regain control.

programme.title: Air Disasters
programme.desc: A modern turboprop nosedives towards the North Sea after being struck by lightning, an unusual feature in the plane may explain why.

programme.title: Air Disasters
programme.desc: Some of history's worst air disasters.

programme.title: Air Disasters
programme.desc: Some of history's worst air disasters.

programme.title: Aerial America
programme.desc: Tour the Wisconsin State Capitol and Milwaukee City Hall, once the tallest building in the world.

programme.title: Aerial America
programme.desc: A tour over two U.S. territories: Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

programme.title: Aerial America
programme.desc: A soaring tour over Southern California explores the stunning beaches, vast deserts, sprawling city and unique culture.

programme.title: Age of Humans
programme.desc: Technology has enabled scientists to trace the journey humans have taken from the origin of life on Earth to the current day.

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: Stories of espionage at sea, including deadly U-boat cat-and-mouse games during WWI, the sinking of the Lusitania, a gun-smuggling private yacht that made history, and liners turned troopships.

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: Revolutionary ship design helped Sir John Hawkins and Sir Francis Drake lead England to defeat the Spanish Armada and become a world power.

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: The evolution of amphibious assault vehicles, including the restoration of Britain's last surviving LCT 7074 landing craft, designed to carry six Churchill tanks.

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: It is considered the largest sea battle in history: the Battle of Leyte Gulf in WWII was three days of ingenious strategy and white-knuckle combat between warships, aircraft and kamikazes.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: A look at life in the Pacific before, during, and after the attack on Pearl Harbor, presented through home movies and combat footage.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: Months after the Pearl Harbor attack, shock waves reverberate in every corner of the Pacific; Americans deploy to stem the enemy's advance; after culture clashes, Allied forces later bond over efforts to thwart Japan's move to control New Guinea.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: In 1943, the United States engages in a new series of island-hopping invasions; the first stop is the Tarawa Atoll, where troops embark upon the largest amphibious invasion ever staged in the Pacific to fight one of the costliest battles of the war.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: By the summer of 1944, the United States is gaining the upper hand in the Pacific War with better training, troop numbers and supply lines; it aims for the heart of Japan's inner defense ring, engaging in a naval battle for Saipan in the Marianas.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: Allied forces move to take the valuable islands of Tinian and Guam that threaten American air operations; meanwhile, Gen. Curtis LeMay is tasked with planning and executing a fire bombing campaign against Japan.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: Allies slug it out on the island of Peleliu in a campaign to pave the way for Gen. MacArthur's return to the Philippines; footage shows troops enduring the muddy muck in the Philippines; Japan unveils a devastating new tactic, the kamikaze.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: By the spring of 1945, the United States begins to take back the Philippines; on Borneo, the Australians invade Labuan; when the United States invades Okinawa, Japan makes a strong stand and launches the biggest kamikaze attacks of the war.

programme.title: The Pacific War in Color
programme.desc: President Harry Truman decides to drop the atomic bomb on Hiroshima and Nagasaki; Emperor Hirohito surrenders, and Gen. Douglas MacArthur arrives to oversee the country's occupation; mortal enemies must now become partners in Japan's rebirth.

programme.title: Race to Victory: WWII Europe
programme.desc: First-person accounts and rare color footage detail the final 100 days of World War II in Europe.

programme.title: Race to Victory: WWII Pacific
programme.desc: The war was over in Europe but in the Pacific one of the bloodiest battles was being fought; a look at the bloody and history-altering final 100 days of the Pacific War, shown through rare war footage and first-person accounts.

programme.title: Battle of Midway: The True Story
programme.desc: America's first victory in the Pacific during World War II is retold from the vantage point of the three U.S. attack planes as they overcame the enemy ambush to face off against the Mitsubishi A6M Zero, a long-range fighter, in the air.

programme.title: Battle of Okinawa in Color
programme.desc: Military cameramen's footage of the Battle of Okinawa shows the intensity of the battle, on land and sea, in vivid color.

programme.title: Richard Pryor: Omit the Logic
programme.desc: Dave Chappelle, Lily Tomlin, Robin Williams, Bob Newhart and others offer insight into the mind of Richard Pryor in filmmaker Marina Zenovich's examination of the late comic's life and career.

programme.title: Madeline's Madeline
programme.desc: Madeline has become an integral part of a prestigious physical theater troupe. When the workshop's ambitious director pushes the teenager to weave her rich interior world and troubled history with her mother into their collective art, the lines between performance and reality begin to blur. The resulting battle between imagination and appropriation rips out of the rehearsal space and goes through all three women's lives.

programme.title: Girlhood
programme.desc: Marieme joins an all-girl gang in the projects of Paris and is slowly turned out of her shell by her three sassy neighbors. As she falls further under their bravado and volatile energy, she begins making brave and foolish choices.

programme.title: Hoop Dreams
programme.desc: Every school day, African-American teenagers William Gates and Arthur Agee travel 90 minutes each way from inner-city Chicago to St. Joseph High School in Westchester, Illinois, a predominately white suburban school well-known for the excellence of its basketball program. Gates and Agee dream of NBA stardom, and with the support of their close-knit families, they battle the social and physical obstacles that stand in their way. This acclaimed documentary was shot over the course of five years.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: A look at three defining chapters in the life of Chiron, a young black man growing up in Miami. His epic journey to manhood is guided by the kindness, support and love of the community that helps raise him.

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: The epic emotional journey of a suburban African American family as they navigate love, forgiveness and coming together in the wake of a tragic loss.

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: Welcome to the infamous "boiler room" -- where twenty something millionaires are made overnight. Here, in the inner sanctum of a fly-by-night brokerage firm, hyper-aggressive young stock jocks peddle to unsuspecting buyers over the phone -- and are rewarded with mansions, Ferraris and more luxury toys than they know what to do with. In this unassuming Long Island enclave, Gen Xers chase the green at breakneck speeds, sometimes one step ahead of the law.

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: Old-school mobster Lenny Cole (Tom Wilkinson) rules London's underworld with an iron fist and a score of well-greased palms. As big-time gangsters and petty crooks all scramble to get their cut of a Russian mobster's crooked land deal, street-wise hustler One Two (Gerard Butler) tries to play both sides of the fence as the lucrative deal falls into the lap of Lenny's presumed-dead son.

programme.title: Obsession
programme.desc: A mechanic begins an affair with his employer's alluring wife.

programme.title: Shangri-LA
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Malibu fire, Rick explores the power of belief and the art of disappearing.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: Bette goes on a mission; Angie learns more about her donor; Alice is pushed by Tom to get in touch with her emotions; Sophie, Finley and Micah are all affected by the way Dani chooses to deal with the fallout of Rodolfo's actions.

programme.title: O
programme.desc: Moving the classic tale of "Othello" onto the basketball courts of a high school, the story focuses on a young black man named Odin (Mekhi Phifer) who is convinced by a conniving best friend, Hugo (Josh Hartnett) that his girlfriend (Julia Stiles) is cheating on him. Of course, what Odin doesn't know is that Hugo is in fact motivated by his own jealousy of Odin's good fortune. It's a sticky situation in classic Shakespearean tradition.

programme.title: Obsessed
programme.desc: Things couldn't be better for Derek Charles (Idris Elba). He's just received a big promotion at work, and has a wonderful marriage with his beautiful wife, Sharon (Beyoncé Knowles). However, into this idyllic world steps Lisa (Ali Larter), a temporary worker at Derek's office. Lisa begins to stalk Derek, jeopardizing all he holds dear.

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: DJay (Terrence Howard) is a pimp living day to day on the tough streets of Memphis, Tennessee. Pushing 40, he's tired of the life he's living and dreams of something greater. When he meets up with an old friend who is now in the recording industry, he's inspired to turn his life around and uses his criminal life as an inspiration to create rap music. When he hears that a rap superstar is coming to town, Djay works a hustle to gain the rapper's attention and hopefully get signed by a label.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: E-Niggma
programme.desc: Comedian Eddie Griffin performs a stand-up set covering his 30-year career, personal life, and real-world issues.

programme.title: Fast and Fierce: Death Race
programme.desc: Jack is on his way to grabbing the cash prize for an illegal car race in Mexico to California, when a desperate woman, fleeing from her gangster boyfriend who runs the tournament, jumps into his car pleading for help.

programme.title: Rafiki
programme.desc: Kena and Ziki live very different lives in Nairobi. Kena works in her father's shop and awaits the start of nursing school, while Ziki passes the days hanging out with her friends and making up dance routines. Their paths cross when their fathers run against each other for seats in the County Assembly, and they find themselves drawn to each other. Soon their interest grows to affection and the girls find ways to love each other despite the ever-watching gaze of the neighborhood.

programme.title: August the First
programme.desc: Tunde's (Ian Alsup) family throws him a graduation party, but they have no idea that he has arranged for his estranged father to attend.

programme.title: Dean Smith
programme.desc: The life of the college basketball coach who retired with the most wins in college basketball history.

programme.title: Mother of George
programme.desc: Ayodele (Isaach De Bankolé) and Adenike (Danai Gurira) marry and start a new life. As months pass without a pregnancy, Adenike feels torn between her Yoruba culture and her new life in America, struggling to save her marriage.

programme.title: The One and Only Dick Gregory
programme.desc: Filmmaker Andre Gaines examines the remarkable life and career of stand-up comic, activist and pop culture icon Dick Gregory. Features interviews with Dave Chappelle, Chris Rock, Kevin Hart and others.

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: A low-level Washington, D.C., public servant, Mays Gilliam (Chris Rock), is thrust into the national spotlight when he's asked by Martin Geller (Dylan Baker), the head of the Democratic Party, to run for president after the party's presidential and vice-presidential nominees are killed in a plane crash. The odds are against Gilliam, mostly because he has a penchant for telling the truth about what is wrong with the country. Remarkably, his straight-talking style catches on with the public.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: Disgraced pro football quarterback Paul Crewe (Adam Sandler) lands in jail, where manipulative Warden Hazen (James Cromwell) recruits him to advise the institution's team. This turns into a lead role quarterbacking a crew of inmates in a game against a team of prison guards. Aided by incarcerated ex-NFL coach Nate Scarborough (Burt Reynolds), Crewe and his team must overcome not only the bloodthirstiness of the opposition, but also the corrupt officials trying to fix the game against them.

programme.title: The Honeymooners
programme.desc: Ralph Kramden (Cedric the Entertainer) drives a bus in New York City but dreams of something more. Unfortunately, none of Ralph's business ideas -- which often incorporate his best friend, Ed (Mike Epps) -- have panned out. Knowing their husbands will never get them out of the city, Ralph's wife, Alice (Gabrielle Union), and Ed's wife, Trixie (Regina Hall), pool their savings to purchase a house in the suburbs. But once the men find out about the secret stash, they might just blow it all.

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: As his wedding day approaches, Peter Klaven (Paul Rudd) realizes he has no one to act as his best man. Through a series of "man-dates," he finds Sydney Fife (Jason Segel), and the pair become instant friends. But as Peter's "bro-mance" with Sydney grows stronger, it threatens his relationship with his fiancee (Rashida Jones), forcing Peter to make a choice.

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: As Freddy's dark history surfaces, Lola and Jackson race to connect the dots in time to save the next victim.

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: A low-level Washington, D.C., public servant, Mays Gilliam (Chris Rock), is thrust into the national spotlight when he's asked by Martin Geller (Dylan Baker), the head of the Democratic Party, to run for president after the party's presidential and vice-presidential nominees are killed in a plane crash. The odds are against Gilliam, mostly because he has a penchant for telling the truth about what is wrong with the country. Remarkably, his straight-talking style catches on with the public.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: Disgraced pro football quarterback Paul Crewe (Adam Sandler) lands in jail, where manipulative Warden Hazen (James Cromwell) recruits him to advise the institution's team. This turns into a lead role quarterbacking a crew of inmates in a game against a team of prison guards. Aided by incarcerated ex-NFL coach Nate Scarborough (Burt Reynolds), Crewe and his team must overcome not only the bloodthirstiness of the opposition, but also the corrupt officials trying to fix the game against them.

programme.title: American Honey
programme.desc: Star (Sasha Lane), an adolescent girl from a troubled home, runs away with a traveling sales crew that drives across the American Midwest selling subscriptions door-to-door. Finding her feet in this gang of teenagers, one of whom is Jake (Shia LaBeouf), she soon gets into the group's lifestyle of hard-partying nights, law-bending days and young love.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: The life and accomplishments of Ulric Cross.

programme.title: Complicit
programme.desc: An MI5 agent (David Oyelowo) tries to prove that a terror suspect (Arsher Ali) is planning an imminent strike in the United Kingdom.

programme.title: The Fits
programme.desc: An 11-year-old tomboy (Royalty Hightower) tries to fit in with her peers after joining an all-girl dance team.

programme.title: Conan the Destroyer
programme.desc: In his second cinematic adventure, the mighty warrior Conan (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is tricked into working for the scheming Queen Taramis (Sarah Douglas). Along with finding a mystical horn, Conan and his allies, which include the fierce fighter, Zula (Grace Jones), and the wisecracking sorcerer, Akiro (Mako), must protect the beautiful young Princess Jehnna (Olivia d'Abo). With deception and danger at every turn, Conan has to use all of his power to defeat the evil foes that stand in his way.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In 1981 New York, a fuel supplier (Oscar Isaac) tries to adhere to his own moral compass amid the rampant violence, corruption and decay that threaten his family and his business.

programme.title: Alex Cross
programme.desc: Alex Cross (Tyler Perry) works as a detective/psychologist for the Detroit Police Department along with his lifelong friend, Tommy Kane (Edward Burns), and detective Monica Ashe (Rachel Nichols). Cross' latest case puts him on a collision course with Picasso (Matthew Fox), a cunning serial killer whose ultimate target is multinational industrialist Giles Mercier (Jean Reno). Cross must find a way inside Picasso's head not only to catch the killer but also to stem the violent urges Cross feels.

programme.title: The Ghost and the Darkness
programme.desc: Sir Robert Beaumont (Tom Wilkinson) is behind schedule on a railroad in Africa. Enlisting noted engineer John Henry Patterson (Val Kilmer) to right the ship, Beaumont expects results. Everything seems great until the crew discovers the mutilated corpse of the project's foreman (Henry Cele), seemingly killed by a lion. After several more attacks, Patterson calls in famed hunter Charles Remington (Michael Douglas), who has finally met his match in the bloodthirsty lions.

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Born into poverty, Ernie Davis (Rob Brown) overcomes many obstacles to get into Syracuse University's football program. Under the guidance of Coach Ben Schwartzwalder (Dennis Quaid), Davis becomes one of the school's best players, even surpassing Jim Brown's achievements. In 1961 Davis becomes the first black player to win the Heisman Trophy, but there is one more obstacle in his life that he must overcome.

programme.title: The Challenger
programme.desc: With help from a legendary trainer (Michael Clarke Duncan), a New York boxer (Kent Moran) returns to the ring to fight his way to a better life.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: A WBO world super bantamweight title bout from Mohegan Sun Casino in Uncasville, Conn., Jan. 23, 2021 (New!).

programme.title: Seven
programme.desc: When retiring police Detective William Somerset (Morgan Freeman) tackles a final case with the aid of newly transferred David Mills (Brad Pitt), they discover a number of elaborate and grizzly murders. They soon realize they are dealing with a serial killer (Kevin Spacey) who is targeting people he thinks represent one of the seven deadly sins. Somerset also befriends Mills' wife, Tracy (Gwyneth Paltrow), who is pregnant and afraid to raise her child in the crime-riddled city.

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: When their ship crashes on an unexplored planet, the survivors of the crash soon discover that this planet that is normally always day is going to soon be in a state of eclipse that will bring out deadly nocturnal creatures. Will a prison convict (Vin Diesel) being transported on the ship end up being the one man who can lead the survivors off the planet?

programme.title: The Lost Boys
programme.desc: Teenage brothers Michael (Jason Patric) and Sam (Corey Haim) move with their mother (Dianne Wiest) to a small town in northern California. While the younger Sam meets a pair of kindred spirits in geeky comic-book nerds Edward (Corey Feldman) and Alan (Jamison Newlander), the angst-ridden Michael soon falls for Star (Jami Gertz) -- who turns out to be in thrall to David (Kiefer Sutherland), leader of a local gang of vampires. Sam and his new friends must save Michael and Star from the undead.

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.sub-title: Let He Who Is Without Sin ..
programme.desc: A stormy vacation on Risa is the result of Worf's distrust of Dax and his abetment of a man who wants to impose traditional values on the pleasure planet.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A vacationing Wesley returns to the Enterprise to find the crew slowly becoming addicted to a new electronic mind game.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard and Data travel to Romulus to investigate an unauthorized mission undertaken by a legendary Federation representative -- Ambassador Spock.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Spock proceeds with his quest for the reunification of Vulcan and Romulus even though he and Picard are suspicious of Romulan motives.

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Douglas Quaid (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is a bored construction worker in the year 2084 who dreams of visiting the colonized Mars. He visits "Rekall," a company that plants false memories into people's brains, in order to experience the thrill of Mars without having to travel there. But something goes wrong during the procedure; Quaid discovers that his entire life is actually a false memory and that the people who implanted it in his head now want him dead.

programme.title: The Lost Boys
programme.desc: Teenage brothers Michael (Jason Patric) and Sam (Corey Haim) move with their mother (Dianne Wiest) to a small town in northern California. While the younger Sam meets a pair of kindred spirits in geeky comic-book nerds Edward (Corey Feldman) and Alan (Jamison Newlander), the angst-ridden Michael soon falls for Star (Jami Gertz) -- who turns out to be in thrall to David (Kiefer Sutherland), leader of a local gang of vampires. Sam and his new friends must save Michael and Star from the undead.

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: The last members of a dying Native American tribe, the Mohicans -- Uncas (Eric Schweig), his father Chingachgook (Russell Means), and his adopted half-white brother Hawkeye (Daniel Day-Lewis) -- live in peace alongside British colonists. But when the daughters (Madeleine Stowe, Jodhi May) of a British colonel are kidnapped by a traitorous scout, Hawkeye and Uncas must rescue them in the crossfire of a gruesome military conflict of which they wanted no part: the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: A depressed man (Edward Norton) suffering from insomnia meets a strange soap salesman named Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt) and soon finds himself living in his squalid house after his perfect apartment is destroyed. The two bored men form an underground club with strict rules and fight other men who are fed up with their mundane lives. Their perfect partnership frays when Marla (Helena Bonham Carter), a fellow support group crasher, attracts Tyler's attention.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A vacationing Wesley returns to the Enterprise to find the crew slowly becoming addicted to a new electronic mind game.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard and Data travel to Romulus to investigate an unauthorized mission undertaken by a legendary Federation representative -- Ambassador Spock.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Spock proceeds with his quest for the reunification of Vulcan and Romulus even though he and Picard are suspicious of Romulan motives.

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.sub-title: Let He Who Is Without Sin ..
programme.desc: A stormy vacation on Risa is the result of Worf's distrust of Dax and his abetment of a man who wants to impose traditional values on the pleasure planet.

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: As Bashir tries to revive their unconscious bodies, Sisko, Odo, Dax and Garak find themselves condemned Bajorans, executed seven years before.

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: When the Runabout crashes on a barren planet, the freezing temperature and lack of amenities induce Odo and Quark to get along or die.

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: A shock Sisko receives when the Holosuite system shorts gives him psychic insight to a lost Bajoran city.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A man claiming to be from the future appears on the Enterprise bridge; Picard considers a risky plan to save a dying planet.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Worf is faced with taking a more active part in his son's life; the Enterprise prepares to test a new propulsion method.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A traumatized boy rescued from a wrecked ship is drawn to Data; Picard attempts to discover the cause of the vessel's destruction.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Troi, Riker and Dr. Crusher fall into unexplained comas while the Enterprise is transporting a group of telepathic historians.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The delicate stability of a genetically engineered society hangs in the balance when the Enterprise tries to prevent a planet's destruction.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Amnesia leaves the crew with the ability to run the ship but no memory of becoming involved in a war they find themselves fighting.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Troi, Data and O'Brien are enveloped by a strange cloud that effects changes in their personalities and causes them to take over the ship.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green learn that a murdered woman was not only a patron of the arts, but that an artist she supported created a painting similar to the crime scene.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives' investigation into the strangulation of an Asian-American stripper leads them to corrupt officers.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives struggle to determine the motive of a club owner who hired two men to kill a stripper.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives suspect a comatose woman's husband tried either to commit a mercy killing or to kill her for her money.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy seeks to prosecute a high-level foreign dignitary for the torture and murder of a New York student 27 years earlier.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A doctor is charged with murder for prescribing a treatment that caused toxic fumes to emit from a breast-cancer patient's body.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Kincaid and McCoy have to decide whether to risk killing a comatose woman to recover the bullet they need as evidence.

programme.title: Fish TV
programme.desc: The Fish TV crew head north to Algoma Country to Lang Lake Resort for a mix of smallmouth and largemouth bass.

programme.title: Lindner's Angling Edge
programme.desc: James Lindner and Jeremy Smith reveal one of the newest, most versatile, and deadly bass tactics on the scene - Tokyo Rigging.

programme.title: Bob Izumi's Real Fishing
programme.desc: Bob is at Cedar Cove Cottages on Big Rideau Lake to show the variety in fish-catching techniques targeting lake trout, smallmouth and largemouth bass as well as panfish.

programme.title: Fishing 411
programme.desc: Jake Romanack of Fishing 411 TV joins forces with Captain Travis White of Keweenaw Charters to fish for the rarely targeted Siscowet strain of Lake Trout found in Lake Superior.

programme.title: Fishing University
programme.desc: Shawn McNulty and Sawyer Chiles, co-owners of American Sport Fish compete with the hosts while discussing the joys of building ponds and stocking rivers and lakes with their various species of fish.

programme.title: Fishful Thinker
programme.desc: Chad LaChance visits Colorado's Blue Lake during a recent boom cycle and breaks down the unique details he used to catch walleye and crappie right under the boat.

programme.title: Hank Parker's Outdoor Magazine
programme.desc: Hank and guide buddy, Captain Chris Noffsinger, set out for the smallmouth of a lifetime in beautiful Traverse City, Michigan... home to world-class smallmouth bass.

programme.desc: Dave calls up the crew and makes the commute to Mother Erie, only for the skies to open up.

programme.title: Lindner's Fishing Edge
programme.desc: Jeremy Smith is after crappie, using micro crankbaits not long after ice-out.

programme.desc: Tricks of the trade and sleight of hand with the lure presentation process; three all-time classic hook designs how to use them; using weighted swimbait hooks for largemouth bass.

programme.title: George Poveromo's World of Saltwater Fishing

programme.title: Reel in the Outdoors
programme.sub-title: Catching a Thrill with Melton Hill Bill
programme.desc: Joe Thomas meets noted Tennessee striper guide Melton Hill Billy Davis, for an in-depth look at trophy striper fishing in the Volunteer State.

programme.title: The Next Bite
programme.sub-title: Sauger Wars: Vertical Jigging on the Illinois River
programme.desc: Professional Anglers Chase Parsons, Tom Kemos and Jim Schiefelbein explore one of the most aggressive bites in the Midwest- vertical jigging for sauger. Late fall on the Illinois River gives anglers a unique opportunity to fish on open water.

programme.desc: Jeremy Smith and Nick Lindner explore the Rainy River in early-fall for some hot big fish action, proving why sturgeon should be on every angler's bucket list.

programme.sub-title: Trolling for Spring Salmon and Summer Walleye

programme.title: America on Drugs
programme.desc: After 9/11, heroin lords and terrorists forged an unholy alliance; Afghanistan is a Narco state; El Chapo goes on the run; Big Pharma becomes the new big drug lord as Americans get addicted and ponder if the war on drugs is worth it.

programme.title: Intervention
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman who squats in an abandoned Chicago house copes with her past by injecting heroin.

programme.title: Intervention

programme.desc: Steven Rinella and Seth Morris are heading out for some beaver trapping along Montana's famed Yellowstone River; Steve and Seth are planning to help out a small ranch by nabbing a few nuisance beavers that have been clogging local irrigation.

programme.desc: Blake and Jimbo spend a few days in one their favorite places with some of their favorite people! Good friends and good eats, good dogs and Greentops!

programme.title: Gun Stories
programme.desc: Joe Mantegna visits the vault, where the FBI stores its most famous confiscated weapons.

programme.title: The Wild Outdoors
programme.desc: This week we're following Whitly In Iowa, she has some unbelievable hunts in early November.

programme.title: Elk Camp

programme.title: The Western Hunter

programme.desc: After years of taking his dad to the Buck Daze hunt in Damascus, Ga., Kevin is bringing his son Kyler this year to hunt with him and Trey Wetherington on a prime Southwest Georgia deer hunting property.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return To The Wild UK
programme.desc: Ben Fogle returns to meet his previous contributors who set up home in remote locations. In this episode, he returns to Scotland to see the Goddard family who live off-grid.

programme.title: Food Factory
programme.desc: A look at how grinders in Tim Hortons' mammoth roasting facility tackle thousands of pounds of coffee beans every hour. Also, we look out how empanadas are made on an epic scale, and the history of cocktail sauce.

programme.title: Food Factory
programme.desc: This episode looks at factories producing jelly buttons, baby puree, feta cheese and baklava.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins his adventures in Hong Kong, with railway highlights including the cable funicular to the top of Hong Kong's highest mountain, the Peak, and the enviably efficient and shiny Mass Transit System.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a two-part adventure through Thailand. Michael helps out at an elephant hospital, tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cuisine.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael continues his exploration of Thailand by rail, steered by his 1913 Bradshaw's guide. First, he steps into the ring under the guidance of champion trainer, Master Toddy, to learn Muay Thai boxing. Can he perfect the Cobra inspired right hook?

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards Vietnam's spectacular Reunification Railway to make a 1,000-mile journey from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi. He visits the container port of Haiphong and finishes in Halong Bay.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. Near the formidable imperial city of Hue, Michael meets milliner Mrs Ngo, who teaches him how to make the iconic conical hat.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the heaving megacity of Jakarta, Michael Portillo uncovers Indonesia's colonial past as part of a Dutch empire and its rich history as a port.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in Java's royal city, Yogyakarta, Michael Portillo visits the Sultan's Palace and witnesses the ancient art of shadow puppetry, known as wayang.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael rides one of the steepest and fastest funicular railways in the world and steps into a tropical paradise as he releases exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Kuala Lumpur, Michael tries the ancient art of pewter smithing and learns how the discovery of tin transformed a muddy estuary into Malaysia's thriving capital.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway tour reaches its final stop - Singapore. Michael walks the streets of Chinatown with a local artist and uncovers the history of the Chinese community there.

programme.desc: Liz descends into a lava cave and discovers how this hidden world could help humans inhabit other planets. She then explores the magical, misty scalesia forests and learns about an invasive species that's spreading across the islands.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: Get ready to understand the science behind Hawaii's stunning beaches. Why does sand appear white, yellow, black, green and red? How do active volcanoes change the coastline? Are other forces at play in shaping these incredible beaches?

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: The harsh reality of life as a hunter is never knowing where your next meal is coming from. To survive, every predator must kill. Investigate the impressive weapons and attack strategies of Africa’s specialized predators.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Meet the unique primates and reptiles searching for water and dodging predators, from ring-tailed lemurs in the east coast rainforests to tiny brown leaf chameleons, in this land of extreme climate variations and habitats.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Winter in Marakele National Park is one of the scarcest, but also most plentiful, times of the year. See how a giraffe’s demise becomes a source of life for the region’s vultures, whose survival depends on the decaying flesh of animals like these.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Cape Town, South Africa is home to twenty types of frogs, but many are threatened by urban development. Meet a variety of the region’s species as we follow western leopard toads on their tenuous journey to breed in the city’s shrinking wetlands.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand’s isolated islands form an unusual paradise, home to a variety of incredible wildlife. Flightless birds, ancient reptiles, and coastal mammals take centre stage, but a closer look reveals another world.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: On the rocky southern tip of Africa lies a narrow peninsula held hostage by the elements. From pounding ice-cold waves to relentless sun, see how extreme conditions demand toughness and adaptability from its resident wildlife.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: Sidle up to a desert wadi-a rare place in the arid landscape where bedrock traps traces of water to create a life-giving waterhole. In these vital valleys, thirsty animals must brave venomous vipers, glowing scorpions, and stalking tarantulas.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: The sprawling primate family includes animals as different as monkeys, lemurs, and humans. Follow primate babies to see how they bond with their mothers, learn to socialize, and adapt to an ever-changing environment.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Grab a front row seat at one of the world’s few accessible lava lakes. Travel with a group to the geologically-active Danakil Depression in Ethiopia and visit the summit of one of the world’s most active volcanoes.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One hour of uninterrupted coral reefs and marine wildlife in the Bahamas.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Italy’s Mount Etna is one of the best places for volcano watchers. Join a team heading to Italy to capture a paroxysmal eruption which produces spectacular lava fountains that can shoot as high as a kilometre into the sky.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: A Hawaiian volcano called Kilauea is one of the most active in the world. After years of constant lava activity, see how a sudden collapse of the crater floor and a massive eruption drains it of lava, making the volcano possible to explore.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: The Arabian Peninsula is the world’s transit hub for 3 billion birds that migrate to and from Europe, Africa, and Asia. Experience how the majestic raptors and magnificent waders fly, hunt, and survive in a region of extremes.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the largest sand island on earth, and home to wild dingoes, six-foot sand-worms, and eucalyptus woodlands. Find out how everything lives happily together in a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Snakes, spiders, and scorpions are the kind of creepy crawlies many fear the most. But in Africa, these species are refined predators. Explore the hunting methods, special skills, and secret love lives of these venomous creatures.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: Learn the story of the tree with the ‘Hollow Heart’. Baobabs have been around for eight hundred years and survive extreme drought by storing water in their trunks, which elephants break off to eat in drier seasons. Luckily, this tree can heal itself.

programme.desc: Dubbed "the most beautiful island in the world" by Jacques Cousteau, Cocos Island is a gem among Costa Rica’s national parks. Explore the area’s hammerhead and Galapagos sharks and meet the large marine species that inhabit these deep waters.

programme.desc: Learn the story of the tree with the ‘Hollow Heart’. Baobabs have been around for eight hundred years and survive extreme drought by storing water in their trunks, which elephants break off to eat in drier seasons. Luckily, this tree can heal itself.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Dubbed "the most beautiful island in the world" by Jacques Cousteau, Cocos Island is a gem among Costa Rica’s national parks. Explore the area’s hammerhead and Galapagos sharks and meet the large marine species that inhabit these deep waters.

programme.title: Arabian Inferno
programme.desc: The Arabian Peninsula is the world’s transit hub for 3 billion birds that migrate to and from Europe, Africa, and Asia. Experience how the majestic raptors and magnificent waders fly, hunt, and survive in a region of extremes.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the largest sand island on earth, and home to wild dingoes, six-foot sand-worms, and eucalyptus woodlands. Find out how everything lives happily together in a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Italy’s Mount Etna is one of the best places for volcano watchers. Join a team heading to Italy to capture a paroxysmal eruption which produces spectacular lava fountains that can shoot as high as a kilometre into the sky.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: A Hawaiian volcano called Kilauea is one of the most active in the world. After years of constant lava activity, see how a sudden collapse of the crater floor and a massive eruption drains it of lava, making the volcano possible to explore.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand’s isolated islands form an unusual paradise, home to a variety of incredible wildlife. Flightless birds, ancient reptiles, and coastal mammals take centre stage, but a closer look reveals another world.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: On the rocky southern tip of Africa lies a narrow peninsula held hostage by the elements. From pounding ice-cold waves to relentless sun, see how extreme conditions demand toughness and adaptability from its resident wildlife.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Snakes, spiders, and scorpions are the kind of creepy crawlies many fear the most. But in Africa, these species are refined predators. Explore the hunting methods, special skills, and secret love lives of these venomous creatures.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Visit one of the most arid and hottest parts of the world to discover how dhub lizards and dromedary camels adapted to withstand the intense conditions. Then move into the more moderate southern mountains, where rare hyrax and chameleons forage.

programme.title: Rooted

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted Bolivian landscapes. Soar across mountains, desert and salt lands encountering flamingos and other exotic birds along the way.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Visit Anak Krakatoa as it enters a violent phase. Known as "The Child of Fire," this volcano is an ancestor of Krakatoa, a volcano known for the largest eruption in modern history. Will its descendant repeat the pattern?

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: In nature, the right stench can mean the difference between life or death. Meet nature's odor-equipped inhabitants, from vomiting grasshoppers to dung-flinging hippos, and even a flower that's adapted to smell like death.

programme.title: Wild Castles
programme.desc: Explore beautiful Heidelberg Castle whose ruins stand in imposing wonder beside the river Neckar in Western Germany. Surrounded by a protected nature reserve, the castle is home to birds of prey and acts as a spawning ground for nearby amphibians.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The drought is driving Mule Deer out of their habitats. The warming ocean is sending Sea Lions in another direction. The Pelicans are trying to survive coastal oil spills. What will become of the beautiful beaches of California?

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Sharks are among the planet’s oldest and most highly evolved predators. Along the coast of southern Africa, pioneers dedicate their lives to learning more about these fascinating creatures and spreading awareness about their plight.

programme.desc: Every summer, the frozen waters of Hudson Bay partially thaw for a few short months. For migrating beluga whales, it's a window of feeding and breeding opportunities, but for polar bears, it's a famine-filled test of survival.

programme.title: Labdarúgás Serie A TIM (?)
programme.desc: (Ismétlés). A Serie A Olaszország legjobb klubcsapatai számára rendezett labdarúgó-bajnokság. Jelenlegi formáját az 1929–1930-as idénytől tartják számon. Azóta 2 idény kivételével rendszeresen megrendezésre kerül. A Serie A-t a világ egyik legerősebb pontvadászati lehetőségének tartják.

programme.desc: (Élő). Amerikai sportokkal foglalkozó talkshow különleges sportágakkal, egyedi témákkal. programme.title: Tempó-magazin (?)
programme.desc: (Ismétlés). A Tempó Autósport Magazin több mint húsz éve szállítja a híreket, a verseny összefoglalókat elsősorban a magyar autósportról ugyanakkor időről-időre kitekint a nemzetközi porondra is, leginkább azokra az eseményekre, ahol magyar versenyzők indulnak. A legfontosabb, legnézettebb futamok első helyen szerepelnek a Tempó kínálatában, így a rali, a rallycross számít a legfontosabb eseménynek a szerkesztőség életében. Emellett beszámolnak a gyorsasági bajnokság, a tereprali, az autocross futamok történéseiről is.

programme.title: A nap hőse (?)
programme.desc: Nem csak idősebb korunkra válhatunk példaképpé, sokan már tizenévesen azok lesznek! A DIGI Sport minisorozata olyan fiatal tehetségeket mutat be, akik teljesítményükkel, eredményeikkel kiemelkednek a kortársaik közül. A minisorozat különálló, 5-7 perces epizódjaiban ilyen fiatalokról láthatnak portrékat a nézőink. Az egyes portrékban bemutatjuk a főszereplőt, megismerjük a sportágát, megkérdezzük tapasztalatairól, bemutatjuk az eddig elért eredményeit, megmutatjuk környezetét, betekintünk edzéseire, megismerjük és meghallgatjuk az edzőjét és akár hozzátartozóit, családját is.

programme.title: S.E.F.T. (?)
programme.desc: A DIGI Sport új, napi rendszerességgel jelentkező magazinműsora komoly küldetéssel indul útjára. Célunk, hogy olyan inspiráló személyeket mutassunk be, akik _ legyenek akár profi vagy hobbisportolók, fiatalok vagy idősek, hírességek vagy civilek _ minden nap tesznek valamit az egészségükért. A műsorban nagyító alá vesszük a szereplők általános szemléletmódját, táplálkozását, sportolási szokásait, valamint ellessük apró praktikáikat, amelyekkel be tudják illeszteni a sportos, egészséges és fitt, azaz a #sefter életmódot rohanó hétköznapjaikba.

Az egyes portrékban bemutatjuk a főszereplőt, megismerjük a sportágát, megkérdezzük tapasztalatairól, bemutatjuk az eddig elért eredményeit, megmutatjuk környezetét, betekintünk edzéseire, megismerjük és meghallgatjuk az edzőjét és akár hozzátartozóit, családját is.

programme.title: Hard Knocks Fighting, Ep. 8
programme.desc: HKFC is one of the world’s premier MMA promotions, showcasing elite up and coming athletes on a global stage. With over 50 events, HKFC, has earned a reputation of being a world class organization, through its global audience and draw of talent. Athletes such as Ronda Rousey, Elias Theodorou, and Misha Cirkunov used HKFC as a staging ground for their UFC careers.

programme.title: Rxf Real Xtreme Fighting, Romania, 16.12.2019
programme.desc: Real Xtreme Fighting (RXF), the largest promotion in Romania and the undisputed leader in the organization of events dedicated to Mixed Martial Arts (MMA), is pleased to invite you on RXF Gala.

programme.title: Goldenfighter Kickboxing Championship, Romania Vs. Holland, Timisoara, Romania, 24.06.2021
programme.desc: Golden Fighter Kickboxing Championship 5 - Romania VS China event is taking place on August 24th in Mamaia-Romania, featuring fighters such as Bogdan Stoica or Hua Guanghua. In the main fight we will see Andrei Stoica vs. Clyde Brunswijk and in the title fight Cristian Milea vs. Kamara Madicke.

programme.title: Hip Show
programme.desc: Hip Show takes combat sports to a whole new level. The fights are 2-on-2 (two teams of two fighters each) in a 3D 12x12 meters arena rather than inside a conventional flat ring. If one of the team members in the arena drops out after a knockout, the fight continues in a 2 versus 1 format. If the remaining team member can hold out for 60 seconds, the bout ends in a tie.

programme.title: Fighting Rookies 2014
programme.desc: Fighting Rookies is a competition with a unique chance for a kickboxer to clim the ladder of success in his sport. The Rookies compete for a chance to become professionals and get the experience needed to succeed at the highest level. Each fighter gives his best to turn his dream into reality. What they do today builds their future and echoes into eternity!
